text: The Khapra beetle (Trogoderma granarium), which originated in South Asia, is one of the world’s most destructive pests of grain products and seeds.Stibick J. 2007. New pest response guidelines: Khapra Beetle APHIS–PPQ–Emergency and Domestic Programs, United States Department of Agriculture, Riverdale, Maryland It is considered one of the 100 worst invasive species in the world. University of Florida Food & Agricultural Services Infestations are difficult to control because of the insect's ability to survive without food for long periods, its preference for dry conditions and low-moisture food, and its resistance to many insecticides. University of Florida Food & Agricultural Services There is a federal quarantine restricting the importation of rice into the U.S,. from countries with known infestations of the beetle. Chicago Tribune == References == Category:Polyphaga Category:Agricultural pests
title: Khapra beetle
